text: Pasir Panjang is a state constituency in Perak, Malaysia, that has been represented in the Perak State Legislative Assembly. The state constituency was first contested in 1995 and is mandated to return a single Assemblyman to the Perak State Legislative Assembly under the first-past-the-post voting system. , the State Assemblyman for Pasir Panjang is Yahaya Mat Nor from the Parti Amanah Negara (PAN), which is part of the state's ruling coalition, Pakatan Harapan (PH); who is a former teacher. == Definition == The Pasir Panjang constituency spans largest portion of southern part of Manjung district including township of Seri Manjung and industrial area of Lumut Port. It contains the polling districts of Kampong Telok, Kampong Baharu, Sungai Wangi, Ladang Sungai Wangi, Kampong Sitiawan, Samudera, Pundut, Bandar Baru Seri Manjung, Seri Manjung, Kampong Dato Sri Kamarudin, Pasir Panjang, Batu 8 Lekir, FELCRA Lekir, Lekir, Lekir Tengah, Sungai Tiram Lekir and Kayan. == Demographics == {| class="wikitable sortable" |+Total electors by polling district in 2016 !Polling district !Electors |- |Kampong Telok | align="right" |650 |- |Kampong Baharu | align="right" |1,314 |- |Sungai Wangi | align="right" |2,072 |- |Ladang Sungai Wangi | align="right" |1,729 |- |Kampong Sitiawan | align="right" |4,577 |- |Samudera | align="right" |4.454 |- |Pundut | align="right" |1,687 |- |Bandar Baru Seri Manjung | align="right" |3,404 |- |Seri Manjung | align="right" |4,854 |- |Kampong Dato Sri Kamarudin | align="right" |1,844 |- |Pasir Panjang | align="right" |1,841 |- |Batu 8 Lekir | align="right" |1,773 |- |FELCRA Lekir | align="right" |715 |- |Lekir | align="right" |2,074 |- |Lekir Tengah | align="right" |1,193 |- |Sungai Tiram Lekir | align="right" |816 |- |Kayan | align="right" |891 |- | style="background: #f2f2f2" |Total | style="background: #f2f2f2" align="right" |35,888 |- | colspan="2" align="right" |Source: Malaysian Election Commission |} == History == {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="4" |Perak State Legislative Assemblyman for Pasir Panjang |- !Assembly !Years !Member !Party |- ! colspan="4" align="center" |Constituency created |- |9th |1995 – 1999 |M. Ramachandran |BN (MIC) |- |12th |2008 – 2013 |Mohammad Nizar Jamaluddin |PR (PAS) |- |13th |2013 – 2018 |Rashidi Ibrahim |BN (UMNO) |- |14th |2018 – |Yahaya Mat Nor |PH (PAN) |} == Election results == The electoral results for the Pasir Panjang state constituency in 2008, 2013 and 2018 are as follows. == See also == * Perak State Legislative Assembly ==References== Category:Constituencies in Malaysia
